gobblin.util

Class RateControlledFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configured
      • org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem
        • gobblin.util.RateControlledFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gobblin.util.Decorator, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configurable

    public class RateControlledFileSystem
extends org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem
implements gobblin.util.Decorator
    Subclass of FileSystem that wraps with a Limiter to control HDFS call rate.

    This classes uses Guava's Cache for storing FileSystem URI to Limiter mapping.

    For methods that require HDFS calls, this class will first acquire a permit using Limiter, to make sure HDFS call rate is allowed by the uppper limit.

    • Method Detail

      • getRateIfRateControlled

        public static com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.Long> getRateIfRateControlled(org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem fs)
        Determines whether the file system is rate controlled, and if so, returns the allowed rate in operations per second.
        Parameters:
        fs - FileSystem to check for rate control.
        Returns:
        Optional.absent() if file system is not rate controlled, otherwise, the rate in operations per second.
